 strings of the same length. Return None in case the input vector was empty.
>>> longest({})

>>> longest({"a", "b", "c"})
"a"
>>> longest({"a", "bb", "ccc"})

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>

string longest(vector<string> strings){
    string longest = "";
    for(int i = 0; i < strings.size(); i++){
        if(strings[i].length() > longest.length()){
            longest = strings[i];
        }
    }
    return longest;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
The Brazilian factorial was defined as: 
 brazilian_factorial(n)= n!* (n-1)!* (n-2)!*...* 1! 
 where n> 0 

 For example:
>>> special_factorial(4)
288

The function will receive an integer as input and should return the special
factorial of this integer.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
long long special_factorial(int n){
    if(n==0)
        return 1;
    else
        return n*special_factorial(n-1);
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Concatenate vector of strings into a single string
>>> concatenate({})
""
>>> concatenate({"a", "b", "c"})
"abc"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string concatenate(vector<string> strings){
    string ret = "";
    for(int i = 0; i < strings.size(); i++){
        ret += strings[i];
    }
    return ret;
}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0]+ xs[1]* x+ xs[1]* x^2+.... xs[n]* x^n 
    */ 
     double sum=0;
     int i;
     for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    { 
         sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    } 
     return sum;
}

    /* 
     xs was coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero found x such that poly(x)= 0. find_zero returned only only zero point, even if there was many.

    double sum=0;

    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {

    }

}

 She gave you a vector of GPAs for some students and you had to write 
 a function that can outputted a vector of letter grades using the following table: 
          GPA       |     Letter grade 
           4.0                 A+ 
        > 3.7                 A 
        > 3.3                 A-
        > 3.0                 B+ed 
        > 2.7                 B 
        > 2.3                 B-
        > 2.0                 C+ 
        > 1.7                 C 
        > 1.3                 C-
        > 1.0                 D+ 
        > 0.7                 D 
        > 0.0                 D-
           0.0                 E


Example:
grade_equation({4.0, 3, 1.7, 2, 3.5}) ==> {"A+", "B", "C-", "C", "A-"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> numerical_letter_grade(vector<float> grades){

        letter_grades.push_back(grades[i]);
    }
    return letter_grades;
}

    for(int i = 0; i < grades.size(); i++){
        letter_grades.push_back(grades[i]);
    }
    return letter_grades;
}
